intro: Androsace minutiflora, commonly known as the dwarf sandpink, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Its compact size and delicate appearance make it a notable species in alpine flora. It is often found in mountainous areas of the Alps and Pyrenees.
